alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Logan; Rawlins; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Wallace County in west central Kansas, eastern Cheyenne and western Thomas Counties in northwestern Kansas, northwestern Logan County in west central Kansas, southwestern Rawlins and Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 1045 PM MDT/1145 PM CDT/... At 957 PM MDT/1057 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of St. Francis to 8 miles south of Sharon Springs. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail, heavy rainfall and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Visibility may be reduced to a mile or less in heavy rain. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 14 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne; Logan; Rawlins; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace
